title: Why so many students are being intoxicated by non-drinking societies
text:
Lizzie Mitchell is tired after a hectic freshers’ week at Leeds University. Not from late nights and constant partying, but from a packed schedule of bowling, afternoon tea and trampolining. She is a member of the High on Life Society, the university’s sober club, one of a growing number at universities across the UK. While rowdy sports societies have been crawling pubs, they have been on a cafe crawl.

These societies will be a blessed relief for the four in 10 public school sixth formers who last week were revealed to be anxious of the infamous initiation rituals at some clubs on campus, which encourage first years to get blind-drunk and participate in humiliating ‘challenges.’

They have...
description: Lizzie Mitchell is tired after a hectic freshers’ week at Leeds University.
